title: Silver Cross Logotype
content:
Hello,

I was looking around on the Internet and found this beautiful logotype (well, I think so at least).

Are there anyone in here who can help me find a font in the same style as the logotype. Just a point in the right direction would be very helpful.

Thank you!

Best regards  
Peter

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [silver\_cross\_logotype.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081024203310/http:/typophile.com/files/silver_cross_logotype.jpg) | 17.78 KB |

 [‹ Laser Printer - dpi question](http://web.archive.org/web/20081024203310/http:/typophile.com/node/33734 "Go to previous forum topic") [I need a 'rubber stamp' like effect... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081024203310/http:/typophile.com/node/50738 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Okkido

comments.content:
Hi Peter,

have a look at [Studio Lettering](http://web.archive.org/web/20081024203310/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=665&subpage=viewfonts). Or [Sudtipos](http://web.archive.org/web/20081024203310/http:/www.sudtipos.com/), esp. [Mr Rafkin](http://web.archive.org/web/20081024203310/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts/58). And [Font Diner](http://web.archive.org/web/20081024203310/http:/www.fontdiner.com/).  
F

That’s a very old pram company from Guiseley, Yorkshire. It was owned by the family of my old school English teacher Mr Wilson.

The logo was like that when I was at school over 30 years ago, and probably a lot longer before that.

Nick Cooke

Florian Hardwig and Grrrben, thank you so much! Studio Lettering is absolutely beautiful! And I really like Sudtipos Calgary Script.

And Nick Cooke, thanks for that info, nice to know that the logotype has a long history behind itself!

Once again, thanks all!
